intro: Agrostophyllum stipulatum subsp. stipulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It is native to parts of Australia and is typically found growing on the branches of eucalyptus and other native trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually less than 1 cm in length, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by providing food for various wildlife species.
